alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Elbert, eastern Arapahoe, southwestern Morgan and eastern Adams Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty winds and generally weakening showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Manila Village to near Byers to 13 miles north of Simla, or along a line extending from 28 miles northeast of Denver to 42 miles southwest of Fort Morgan to 25 miles west of Limon. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deer Trail, Hoyt, Shamrock, Leader, Byers, Adena, Agate and Cottonwood Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
